title: Elliptic curves and spin
authors: Peter Koymans and Peter Vang Uttenthal
abstract:
In the early 2000s, Ramakrishna asked the question: For the elliptic curve $$
E: y^2 = x^3 - x, $$ what is the density of primes $p$ for which the Fourier
coefficient $a_p(E)$ is a cube modulo $p$? As a generalization of this
question, Weston--Zaurova formulated conjectures concerning the distribution of
power residues of degree $m$ of the Fourier coefficients of elliptic curves
$E/\mathbb{Q}$ with complex multiplication. In this paper, we prove their
conjecture for cubic residues using the analytic theory of spin. Our proof
works for all elliptic curves $E$ with complex multiplication.
